question_text:
Question 38 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
MCQ (1M) 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Question ID : 823251540 
 
A Binary search tree T contains n distinct elements. What is time complexity of picking an elements in 
T that is smaller than the maximum element in T? 
 
(A) 
( log )
n
n
θ
 
(B) 
(log )
n
θ
 
(C) 
( )
n
θ
 
(D) 
(1)
θ
 
Ans. 
D 
Sol. 
In BST maximal element will be in right most leaf node
If root has right sub tree then root itself is smaller than maximum value
If root does not have right subtree then root is maximum element and left child of root is the required 
element.
